Discovered a Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) vulnerability in a contact form of a web application
Crafted a malicious web page that included a hidden form that submitted a message to the contact form on behalf of the victim user
Tricked the victim user into visiting my malicious web page
Submitted a message to the website owner with the victim user's credentials
Recommended that the application implement proper CSRF protections such as adding a random token to each form submission and validating the token on the server side
Recommended additional user authentication measures such as requiring users to enter their password to submit sensitive information
